title: All Things Considered - BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition
description:
All Things Considered 
 BA Visual Arts Thesis Exhibition 
 Finley Gallery, Finley Hall 
 Exhibition dates: April 24-30, 2025 
 Closing Reception: Wednesday April 30, 6-8pm 
   
 Celebrate the end of the year with this brilliant showcase from our rising Visual Arts graduates! This exhibition marks the culmination of their degree, launching their creative journeys. Each student presents a cohesive body of artwork in the Finley Galleries, our final exhibition of the Fall 2025 semester. Join us on Wednesday, April 30 at 6pm to meet the artists at the closing reception. 
   
 All Things Considered  features an impressive range of interdisciplinary approaches: mixed-media sculpture, large-scale painting, hand-sewn textiles, ceramics, video projection, photography, and room-sized installations. 45 Visual Arts graduates invite you to explore their creative research and current concerns, on view through these vibrant capstone projects!  On view from April 24 till April 30, 2025.  
 Exhibiting Artists: Section 1: Santiago Arcila, Kelly Arita, Sabrina Gatti, Ian Hagen, Jiapsi Juarez-Cipriano, Bryana Martinez, Agnieszka Palka, Krisha Ravishankar, Jin Scheef, Anacia Sessoms, Walaa Shaabneh, Julea Sorrentino, Katie Weuste, Margo Wittlinger, Joseph Visco 
 Section 2: Jivon Batres, Nick Cruz, Genesis Garcia-Morales, Tevin Gomez, Lauryn Jeffrey, Bralen Jones, Aaron Leung, Emily Luh, Lara Maisonneuve, Gabriel Rodriguez, Amaya Tiozon, Sadie Vizcaino, Odessa Whitlock, Brendan Wilsea 
   
 Section 3: Frankie Christie, Paola Cruz, Gina DeMartino, Marlena Holston, Gabriel Marano, Jonathan Muruzumbay, Quara Phillips-Hill, Edward Puello, Meghan Sibert, Brion Spruill, Antonia Sussina, Kimberly Triana Vallejo, Grace Whitteaker, Zoe Yeung, Cedric Yoo, Claudia Zuraw

title: InterVarsity The Gather
location: Susan A. Cole Hall 141 - Admissions Presentation Room
description: Our goal is to deepen our love and knowledge of Jesus and his word, and learn what it means to have a relationship with him. We encourage and strengthen one another as we go, and in doing so we deepen our fellowship as brothers and sister in Christ

title: Commuter Connect Program
description: Commuter Connect Program  is designed to support commuter students by fostering a sense of community and engagement on campus. Through mentorship, peer connections, and tailored events, the program helps commuters integrate into university life, access valuable resources, and build a support network that enhances both their academic and social experiences. It includes regular meetups, study groups, and workshops to ensure commuter students feel connected and supported throughout their time at the university.   Commuter Connect Signup Link:

title: Relax and Reboot
description: Join Peer Mentor Tildah for Relax and Reboot,  a wellness event designed to help residents de-stress and recharge. Featuring a DIY stress ball and aromatherapy station, the event offers a creative, hands-on way to promote relaxation and self-care in a supportive, low-pressure environment. Food and drinks will be available

title: Stupid F*cking Bird
description:
Written by Aaron Posner Sort of Adapted from The Seagull by Anton Chekhov 
 Directed by Cristina Angeles 
 An aspiring young director rampages against the art created by his mother’s generation. A nubile young actress wrestles with an aging Hollywood star for the affections of a renowned novelist. And everyone discovers just how disappointing love, art, and growing up can be. In this irreverent, contemporary, and very funny remix of Chekhov’s The Seagull, Aaron Posner stages a timeless battle between young and old, past and present, in search of the true meaning of it all. Original songs composed by James Sugg draw the famously subtextual inner thoughts of Chekhov’s characters explicitly to the surface. Stupid F*cking Bird will tickle, tantalize, and incite you to consider how art, love, and revolution fuel your own pursuit of happiness. 
   
 Fri, April 25 @ 7:30 PM Sat, Apr 26 @ 2:00 PM & 7:30 PM Tue, April 29 @ 7:30 PM Wed, April 30 @ 7:30 PM Thu, May 1 @ 7:30 PM 
   
 I acknowledge that RSVPing to this event does not substitute a physical ticket for entry.  I understand I must acquire a physical ticket at The Alexander Kasser Theater Box Office before show time.

title: Campus Earth Month
description:
The Montclair Office of Sustainability is launching a new tradition this April, Earth Month! 
 Participate in Campus Earth Month throughout April by collecting code words and earning entries to win prizes. Each code word you collect or action you complete will earn you an entry into the Campus Earth Month giveaway. The more entries you earn, the better your odds.  
 You could win a Go Pro, a Yeti Cooler, $250 Red Hawk Dollars, a Nintendo Switch, and more!  
 Each decision you make has the potential to be good for the planet and people. No one can do it all, but we can all do something. This April, make sure your ledger is balanced so you are always…+1 for the Planet! 
 We hope to see you out on campus and Happy Earth Month, Red Hawks!

title: Webinar for Educational Leadership
description:
If you’ve thought about the next step in your education career - whether that means becoming a principal, stepping into an admin role, or just making a bigger impact - we want to meet you.  Our Educational Leadership program is built for professionals like you who want to lead with purpose, create change, and shape the future of schools and students. We're hosting a  Webinar for Educational Leadership May 1 at 4:30 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Educational Leadership (MA)   Online, Fast Track, Core Choice, and Offsite 
 Supervisor Certification 
 Principal Certification 
 Director of School Counseling Services Certification

title: BCMSU's Creative & Research Showcase: A Campus-Wide Celebration of Student Achievement
organization: Bloomfield Center for Student Leadership & Engagement (CSLE)
description: a campus-wide celebration of student achievement across disciplines. This day-long event will feature presentations, performances, and exhibitions highlighting the work of our talented students across the disciplines.

title: L'Atelier Montclair: Threaded Awakening
location: Presentation Hall, School of Communication and Media
description:
MSU fashion show. Student designs, surreal dreams. 
 This is our annual fashion show, a student-produced event showcasing garments created within our program's curriculum. Proceeds from ticket sales will directly support our students and program, enabling us to continue our mission and vision. 
 Tickets are $10: Get Tickets

title: Spring 2025 Fashion Show  - L’Atelier Montclair: Threaded Awakening
location: School of Communication and Media, Presentation Hall
description:
🌟 Get ready for  L’Atelier Montclair: Threaded Awakening  — the Spring 2025 Fashion Show presented by Department of Art & Design’s Fashion Design & Merchandising Program! 🧵✨ 
   
 This year’s showcase celebrates innovation, craftsmanship, and the unique voices of student designers from across all studio courses, plus independent talents bringing bold new visions to the runway. Inspired by the elegance of couture and the raw power of textile transformation,  Threaded Awakening  promises a night of style, artistry, and fresh perspective. 
   
 👗 Designed + constructed by students   🎓 Mentored by expert faculty   🎬 Produced by ARTX400 under Prof. Carlos DeMoya   📍 May 1 | Presentation Hall, School of Communication & Media   ⏰ Doors: 5:00 PM | Show: 5:45 PM   🎟️ $10 tickets on Eventbrite (link below)   💻 Live Streamed for remote viewers! 
   
 Follow @lateliermontclair for sneak peeks, designer highlights, and behind-the-scenes action. Don’t miss this celebration of the next generation of fashion!  
   
 https://www.eventbrite.com/e/latelier-montclair-threaded-awakening-tickets-1303406777759?utm-campaign=social&utm-content=attendeeshare&utm-medium=discovery&utm-term=listing&utm-source=cp&aff=ebdsshcopyurl

title: Study Hall
description: Come hang out in the community lounge and study for finals with your Sinatra Hall Council! Free food and drinks while supplies last.

title: Spanish Writing Center Tutoring Hours
organization: Center for Latino Heritage & Spanish Language Excellence
description: Our Spanish Writing Center at CLaSE (Center for Latino heritage and Spanish language Excellence) is now offering  more  tutoring hours online and in-person starting  February 3rd . Our amazing tutors are Lorena Tacle and Ivan Podobed. If you need to improve you writing skills in Spanish, polish your written structures, or get help with your paper, article, letter, etc. check our tutors availability and book an appointment in our website https://www.montclair.edu/clase/our-initiatives/spanish-writing-center/

title: MA Higher Education Capstone Conference
description:
On behalf of the Department of Educational Leadership and the MA Higher Education program, we would like to invite you to join us at the annual Capstone Conference on Friday, May 2nd from 5:30PM to 8PM in University Hall Room 1010. The Capstone Conference provides students in the MA Higher Education program with the opportunity to be able to showcase and share the work that they have done in the Capstone course, which is the culminating experience in the Masters program. 
 Refreshments will be served. 
 Please RSVP  here . We hope that you will be able to join us to celebrate the graduating Higher Education students!

title: Spring 2025 Product Design Thesis Showcase
location: School of Communication and Media, Presentation Hall
description:
🎉 Join us for the highly anticipated Spring 2025 Product Design Thesis Showcase! 
   
 🗓️  May 2, 2025 🕕  6:00 PM 📍  School of Communication and Media, Presentation Hall 
   
 We are  thrilled  to invite you to an inspiring celebration of creativity, innovation, and the culmination of months of hard work by our incredibly talented Product Design seniors. 🌟 
   
 Whether you’re an industry pro scouting fresh talent, a design enthusiast looking for your next spark of inspiration, or just curious about what the future of product design looks like—this is the event for you! 
   
 ✨ Expect groundbreaking concepts 🎤 Captivating presentations 🔍 Engaging interactive Q&A 
   
 This is more than a showcase—it’s a launchpad for the next generation of design leaders. Don’t miss your chance to experience their vision, dedication, and design excellence up close.

title: FRANKENSTEIN
description:
Manual Cinema 
 Multi-Media Puppetry, Live Music, Film, Theater 
 Love, loss, and creation merge in unexpected ways as Manual Cinema presents its thrilling version of the classic Gothic tale Frankenstein. This Chicago-based performance collective masterfully merges shadow puppetry, cinematic techniques, sound effects, and live music to deliver a hauntingly unique experience unlike anything you have witnessed before. The ingenious blend of Mary Shelley's biography and her iconic creation, Frankenstein, offers a fresh perspective on the beauty and horror of creation. 
 By intertwining the real-life and fictional narratives of Shelley, Victor Frankenstein, and Frankenstein’s Monster, Manual Cinema intricately showcases how family, community, and education can shape personhood—or destroy it by their absence. Don't miss out on this haunting interpretation of a classic! 
 Court Theatre presented the World Premiere of Frankenstein in Chicago, November 2018. Frankenstein had its New York premiere at the Public Theater’s Under the Radar Festival in January 2019 and its international debut in Scotland at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in August 2019. 
 Recommended for ages 12 and up. 
 This production includes loud sounds, flashing lights and haze. 
 Tickets are prepaid for undergraduate students with valid ID for more information  click here

title: Embed Library Resources in Canvas
description:
In this hands-on session, you'll learn how to quickly and easily embed library resources such as databases, journals, e-books, articles and streaming video into your Canvas course. We'll walk you through permalinking and creating persistent links to prompt your students to log in and access library content hassle-free. We'll also cover adding a librarian to your course and demonstrate the Library Resources tab in Canvas. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Canvas and Library Integration by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14544735

title: 2025 NJAC Baseball Tournament @ Yogi Berra Stadium May 3-5, 2025
description:
https://njacsports.com/tournaments/?id=388 
 Ticket Information Ticket prices for all rounds of the 2025 NJAC Baseball Championship (including contests at campus sites) are $10.00 for adults; $5.00 for students (with ID); $5.00 for senior citizens; and $5.00 for children. All ticket sales are CASH ONLY. 
 Pet Policy Pets are not permitted at any venue at any time during the course of any NJAC tournament for the safety of participants and spectators.

title: 2025 OSJD Impact Awards: Celebrating Community, Service and Excellence
description:
We are proud to announce the "2025 OSJD Impact Awards: Celebrating Community, Service and Excellence" on Tuesday, May 6, 2025 at 5:30 p.m. in the University Hall Conference Center.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Join us for a magical night as we recognize five outstanding members of our university community for their outstanding contributions to improving our campus experience for all. Open to all to attend! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
   
 More details are provided in the nomination form. 
   
 Impact Awards nominations are due by Friday, March 7, 2025. Nomination Form:  HERE! 
   
 TO ATTEND, YOU MUST RSVP VIA THIS ENGAGE EVENT PAGE FOR YOURSELF AND UP TO 2 GUESTS!

title: MSW Virtual Information Session
description: Our  MSW program  prepares you to support vulnerable children, teens, and families through both clinical practice and advocacy work. Whether you prefer to learn on campus or need the flexibility of our  new online option , we’ve got you covered. We're hosting a   virtual information session May 6 at 7:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals.

title: Embed Library Resources in Canvas
description:
In this hands-on session, you'll learn how to quickly and easily embed library resources such as databases, journals, e-books, articles and streaming video into your Canvas course. We'll walk you through permalinking and creating persistent links to prompt your students to log in and access library content hassle-free. We'll also cover adding a librarian to your course and demonstrate the Library Resources tab in Canvas. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Canvas and Library Integration by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14544812

title: Graduate Mathematics Education Programs Virtual Info Session
description:
Tune into our virtual information session as the faculty discuss the following graduate programs: 
 
 MS in Mathematics, Mathematics Education Concentration 
 MA in Mathematics Education (formerly called MA in Teaching Middle Grades Mathematics) 
 Teaching Middle Grades Mathematics Certificate Program 
 Teacher Certification in Elementary School with Subject Matter Specialization: Mathematics Grades 5-8 
 
 Register for the information session here!

title: MESHELL NDEGEOCELLO NO MORE WATER: THE GOSPEL OF JAMES BALDWIN
description: Grammy-winning multi-instrumentalist, singer, and songwriter  Meshell Ndegeocello  pays musical tribute to her literary hero, author James Baldwin, with her latest show,  No More Water: The Gospel of James Baldwin .

title: Embed Library Resources in Canvas
description:
In this hands-on session, you'll learn how to quickly and easily embed library resources such as databases, journals, e-books, articles and streaming video into your Canvas course. We'll walk you through permalinking and creating persistent links to prompt your students to log in and access library content hassle-free. We'll also cover adding a librarian to your course and demonstrate the Library Resources tab in Canvas.

title: CPT Workshop - International Students (F-1 Visa Holders) Only
description: For students who are planning to apply for CPT for the summer or fall 2025 semesters. Learn more about Curricular Practical Training (CPT) for F-1 students. Any student planning to apply for CPT is REQUIRED to attend a workshop before they can apply. This workshop is for CURRENT students ONLY - any other attendees will be removed.

title: Research Time Management
description:
Research Time Management 
 
 Research time management is an essential skill for academic success. In this workshop, participants will: 
 
 Learn the steps of the research process 
 Create a research timeline 
 Set SMART goals 
 Learn strategies to avoid procrastination 
 Learn about library "shortcuts" 
 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14525816

title: MAT Initial Teaching Certification Virtual Information Session
description:
Our   Master of Arts in Teaching with Initial Certification Programs   offer pathways to certification so that you can lead classes and drive positive outcomes for students.  
 🏆 Our nationally and internationally recognized Teacher Education Program has many unique features, which include curricular emphasis, the  Center of Pedagogy , as well as partnerships with local schools and communities.    
 We're hosting a   virtual information session on May 14 at 5:00 PM.  This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals.

title: Counseling MA Virtual Information Session (All Concentrations)
description:
The world needs more counselors who lead with empathy, insight, and purpose - and if you're ready to take that next step, we're here to help you get there.  We're hosting a  virtual information session on May 19 at 4:00PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Addictions Counseling 
 Clinical Mental Health Counseling 
 School Counseling 
 Student Affairs/Higher Education

title: Fact-Checking And Misinformation
description:
This workshop will discuss the art of fact-checking sources. By learning to recognize bias, disinformation, and misinformation, you will gain the critical thinking skills vital for research and informed decision-making. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14525834

title: Child Advocacy and Policy (MA) & Child Advocacy (Certificate) Webinar
description:
If you're passionate about protecting children, influencing policy, and standing up for those who need it most, our graduate programs in child advocacy and policy are for you. We're hosting a  webinar on May 19 at 6:00 PM (EST) . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. This session will cover the following programs:  
 
 Online Master of Arts in Child Advocacy and Policy 
 Child Advocacy (Certificate) – Online

title: Higher Education MA Virtual Information Session
description:
Think you you belong in Higher Ed leadership? We can help you get there.  
 Whether you're already working in higher ed or looking to break into the field, our flexible program is designed to meet you where you are - and help you go even further. 
 We're hosting a  virtual information session on  May 21 at 12:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals. 
 Our coursework offers a broad focus on administration and leadership, preparing students for a variety of roles in higher education. The curriculum integrates organizational and social science perspectives and explores key administrative and programmatic issues.

title: Annotated Bibliographies
description:
Learn about the different types of annotated bibliographies, what information is included in each type, and how to format your annotated bibliography. 
 Register Here: https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14525954

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost - $40-$50 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturdays, 05/31 - 06/21 
 9 a.m. - 9:45 a.m. 
 Student Recreation Center Pool

title: Learn to Swim - Adults
description:
Our program focuses on the strengths and skills needed for swimming, and will help swimmers of all ages develop and refine their skills. Whether you already know how to swim or are just starting out, our classes will help you become a stronger swimmer and develop skills that will last a lifetime. Classes are taught under the watchful eye of our trained instructors, and include lessons on a variety of different strokes and techniques. Our program boasts an excellent instructor to student ratio, with one instructor for every 3 participants for beginner classes, and one instructor to five students at other levels. 
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through  Fusion , in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost - $40-$50

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided, however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.
